# Based on VAE guide from Keras RStudio

https://keras.rstudio.com/articles/examples/variational_autoencoder.html
https://arxiv.org/pdf/1312.6114.pdf

```{r}
# Note: This code reflects pre-TF2 idioms.
# For an example of a TF2-style modularized VAE, see e.g.: https://github.com/rstudio/keras/blob/master/vignettes/examples/eager_cvae.R
# Also cf. the tfprobability-style of coding VAEs: https://rstudio.github.io/tfprobability/

# With TF-2, you can still run this code due to the following line:
if (tensorflow::tf$executing_eagerly())
  tensorflow::tf$compat$v1$disable_eager_execution()

library(keras)
K <- keras::backend()
```

```{r}
# Parameters --------------------------------------------------------------
batch_size <- 100L
original_dim <- 784L
latent_dim <- 2L
intermediate_dim <- 256L
epochs <- 50L
epsilon_std <- 1.0
```

```{r}
# Data preparation --------------------------------------------------------
mnist <- dataset_mnist()
print(mnist$train$x[1,,])

library(pheatmap)
pheatmap(mnist$train$x[1,,], cluster_rows = FALSE, cluster_cols = FALSE, colorRampPalette(c("black","white"))(255))
```


```{r}
x_train <- mnist$train$x/255
x_test <- mnist$test$x/255
x_train <- array_reshape(x_train, c(nrow(x_train), 784), order = "F")
x_test <- array_reshape(x_test, c(nrow(x_test), 784), order = "F")

print(dim(x_train))
```

# Model Definition and Structure 

ENCODER 
1. x 
2. h
3. z_mean + z_log_var
   Concanate(z_mean and z_log_var)

  ENCODER- BOTTLENECK
  1. lambda 

DECODER
1. decoder_h
2. h_decoded
3. x_decoded_mean 

GENERATOR
1. decoder_input
2. h_decoded_2 
3. x_decoded_mean_2

```{r}
# Model definition --------------------------------------------------------

x <- layer_input(shape = c(original_dim))
h <- layer_dense(x, intermediate_dim, activation = "relu")
z_mean <- layer_dense(h, latent_dim)
z_log_var <- layer_dense(h, latent_dim)

sampling <- function(arg){
  z_mean <- arg[, 1:(latent_dim)]
  z_log_var <- arg[, (latent_dim + 1):(2 * latent_dim)]
  
  epsilon <- k_random_normal(
    shape = c(k_shape(z_mean)[[1]]), 
    mean=0.,
    stddev=epsilon_std
  )
  
  z_mean + k_exp(z_log_var/2)*epsilon
}
```


```{r}
# note that "output_shape" isn't necessary with the TensorFlow backend
z <- layer_concatenate(list(z_mean, z_log_var))  
z2 <- layer_lambda(z, sampling)
z <- z2

# we instantiate these layers separately so as to reuse them later
decoder_h <- layer_dense(units = intermediate_dim, activation = "relu")
decoder_mean <- layer_dense(units = original_dim, activation = "sigmoid")
h_decoded <- decoder_h(z)
x_decoded_mean <- decoder_mean(h_decoded)

# end-to-end autoencoder
vae <- keras_model(x, x_decoded_mean)

# encoder, from inputs to latent space
encoder <- keras_model(x, z_mean)

# generator, from latent space to reconstructed inputs
decoder_input <- layer_input(shape = latent_dim)
h_decoded_2 <- decoder_h(decoder_input)
x_decoded_mean_2 <- decoder_mean(h_decoded_2)
generator <- keras_model(decoder_input, x_decoded_mean_2)

summary(vae)
```


```{r}
vae_loss <- function(x, x_decoded_mean){
  xent_loss <- (original_dim/1.0)*loss_binary_crossentropy(x, x_decoded_mean)
  kl_loss <- -0.5*k_mean(1 + z_log_var - k_square(z_mean) - k_exp(z_log_var), axis = -1L)
  xent_loss + kl_loss
}

vae %>% compile(optimizer = "rmsprop", loss = vae_loss)
```


```{r}
# Model training ----------------------------------------------------------

vae %>% fit(
  x_train, x_train, 
  shuffle = TRUE, 
  epochs = epochs, 
  batch_size = batch_size, 
  validation_data = list(x_test, x_test)
)
```


```{r}
# Visualizations ----------------------------------------------------------

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
x_test_encoded <- predict(encoder, x_test, batch_size = batch_size)

x_test_encoded %>%
  as_data_frame() %>% 
  mutate(class = as.factor(mnist$test$y)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = V1, y = V2, colour = class)) + geom_point()
```


# Lets print out 1 

```{r}
input <- runif(2, -3, 3)
dim(input) <- c(1,2)
  
generated_number <- predict(generator, input) %>% matrix(ncol = 28)

pheatmap(generated_number, cluster_rows = FALSE, cluster_cols = FALSE, colorRampPalette(c("black","white"))(255))
```



```{r}
# display a 2D manifold of the digits
n <- 35  # figure with 15x15 digits
digit_size <- 28
```


```{r}
# we will sample n points within [-4, 4] standard deviations
grid_x <- seq(-4, 4, length.out = n)
grid_y <- seq(-4, 4, length.out = n)

rows <- NULL
for(i in 1:length(grid_x)){
  column <- NULL
  for(j in 1:length(grid_y)){
    z_sample <- matrix(c(grid_x[i], grid_y[j]), ncol = 2)
    column <- rbind(column, predict(generator, z_sample) %>% matrix(ncol = 28) )
  }
  rows <- cbind(rows, column)
}
rows %>% as.raster() %>% plot()
```
